name: Air
description: Contrary to the name of this website, air can't be spawned as an item in your inventory. It is used as a block to represent, well, air! It can't be seen and is non-solid (so you can walk through it).

name: Stone
description: Stone, not to be confused with cobblestone, can only be obtained when a stoneblock is broken with a silk touch pickaxe. It is required for many redstone items such as the comparator, and decorative items like stonebricks.

properties.recipes_used_in: Stone Slab, Stone Pressure Plate, Stone Button, Stone Bricks, Redstone Repeater, Redstone Comparator, Stone Stairs, Stonecutter

name: Granite
description: Granite is similar to the stone block, but has less uses (currently). It is primarily used as a decorative block, but also can be used instead of stone in a few crafting recipes.

name: Polished Granite
description: Polished granite has all the same properties as granite (it can be used interchangeably in crafting recipes). It is currently primarily a decorative block but it is believed that Mojang have plans to change this in future.

name: Grass Block
description: Grass is an essential block in Minecraft. Not only was it one of the first blocks introduced to the game, but it is required to plant seeds. Right clicking a grass block with bone meal creates tall grass. It can also be eaten by sheep.

name: Dirt
description: Dirt is obtained when a grass block is mined. Dirt is essential for farming and can be used to make course dirt.

name: Coarse Dirt
description: Coarse dirt is made with regular dirt and has the added chance of growing farming items like saplings.

name: Podzol
description: Podzol only generates in mega taiga biomes. It is used to grow mushrooms, as on podzol, they will grow regardless of light level.

name: Cobblestone
description: Cobblestone is obtained by mining regular stone with any pickaxe. It can be used to make stone tools, furnaces and other essential Minecraft items.

name: Bedrock
description: Bedrock cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft. It covers the lowest point of the world to prevent people from falling in the void. It cannot be broken in survival mode.

name: Sand
description: Sand is found in the desert and near the ocean/rivers. It is used to make glass (by smelting it in a furnace). It is also one of the few blocks to respond to gravity - if it does not have a supprting block underneath it, it will fall to the ground.

name: Red Sand
description: Red sand is very similar to regular sand. The only differences between red sand and regular sand are the textures, and red sand's inability to be used to craft concrete.

name: Gravel
description: Gravel, like sand, is one of the few blocks in Minecraft that responds to gravity. Despite being in the game for a long time, its only real use is to make concrete. It can also be traded with villagers for emeralds.

name: Gold Ore
description: Gold ore can be smelted in a furnace to make golden ingots. Before it has been smelted, it does not much use. It is about five times rarer than iron ore, and only spawns below Y 32.

name: Iron Ore
description: Iron ore, similar to gold ore, can be smelted in a furnace to make iron ingots. Before it has been smelted, it does not much use.

name: Coal Ore
description: This block can only be obtained when it is mined with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. When mined, it drops coal, which can be used as a fuel in a furnace.

name: Oak Log
description: Wood is the primary constituent of trees in Minecraft. It can be broken with your hands, but using an axe is much faster. When placed in a crafting square, it yields 4 wooden planks which is an ingredient in many important crafting recipes.

name: Oak Leaves
description: Oak leaves are a part of trees in Minecraft. When broken, there is a 1/200 chance that an apple will be dropped. The leaves block itself cannot be obtained unless shears are used to break it.

name: Spruce Leaves
description: Leaves are a part of trees in Minecraft. When broken, there is a 1/200 chance that an apple will be dropped. The leaves block itself cannot be obtained unless shears are used to break it.

name: Birch Leaves
description: Leaves are a part of trees in Minecraft. When broken, there is a 1/200 chance that an apple will be dropped. The leaves block itself cannot be obtained unless shears are used to break it.

name: Jungle Leaves
description: Leaves are a part of trees in Minecraft. When broken, there is a 1/200 chance that an apple will be dropped. The leaves block itself cannot be obtained unless shears are used to break it.

name: Acacia Leaves
description: Acacia leaves are one of the most recently added leave textures. The block itself acts just like regular leaves, but only generates in acacia tree structures.

name: Dark Oak Leaves
description: Dark oak leaves are one of the most recently added leave textures. The block itself acts just like regular leaves, but only generates in dark oak tree structures.

name: Sponge
description: Sponge can be used to soak up water in Minecraft. Whilst an unsoaked sponge cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft, placing a wet sponge in a furnace yields this block (which can then be used to soak up water).

name: Wet Sponge
description: Wet sponges can be obtained from ocean monuments and are dropped by elder guardians upon death. They are also formed when a sponge becomes fully soaked. To obtain a regular sponge from a wet sponge, the wet sponge must be placedin a furnace (with appropriate fuel).

name: Glass
description: Glass is obtained when sand is smelted in a furnace. When broken without a silk touch pickaxe, it does not yield the glass block. It is a transparent block, and used in crafting recipes for beacons, stained glass, daylight sensors, glass bottles, end crystals and various other items.

properties.recipes_used_in: Glass Pane, Beacon, Daylight Detector, White Stained Glass, Orange Stained Glass, Magenta Stained Glass, Light Blue Stained Glass, Yellow Stained Glass, Lime Stained Glass, Pink Stained Glass, Gray Stained Glass, Light Gray Stained Glass, Cyan Stained Glass, Purple Stained Glass, Blue Stained Glass, Brown Stained Glass, Green Stained Glass, Red Stained Glass, Black Stained Glass, Glass Bottle, End Crystal

name: Lapis Lazuli Ore
description: The lapis lazuli ore block can only be obtained when lapis lazuli is mined with a silk touch pickaxe. It does not have any purpose when in item form.

name: Lapis Lazuli Block
description: The lapis lazuli block can be made by placing 9 lapis lazulis in the crafting table (one in each square). It is primarily a decorative block.. but could be used to conserve storage space (holds 9 lapis lazulis).

name: Dispenser
description: It should come as no surprise to you that the dispenser block dispenses items. It can be activated with redstone. In the cases of some items, like arrows and fire charges, it has special behaviour (e.g. shooting the item rather than just dropping it).

name: Sandstone
description: Sandstone generates naturally in beaches and deserts, along with structures like temples. It is primarily a decorative block as it serves little to no purpose.

properties.recipes_used_in: Cut Sandstone, Sandstone Slab, Sandstone Stairs, Sandstone Wall

name: Chiseled Sandstone
description: Chiseled sandstone can be made by placing 2 sandstone slabs into a crafting menu. It is primarily a decorative block as it serves little to no purpose.

name: Cut Sandstone
description: Cut sandstone, formerly known as smooth sandstone, can be crafted by placing 4 (2x2) sandstone blocks in a crafting table. It is primarily a decorative block as it serves little to no purpose.

name: Note Block
description: Note blocks can produce sounds when punched. The sound they produce can be changed by right clicking the block.

name: Powered Rail
description: Powered rails can be used to propel minecarts on a track. They also interact with redstone and can be turned off/on.

name: Detector Rail
description: Detector rails can detect when a minecart runs over them. They can be used in redstone circuits, which allows for redstone contraptions that react to minecarts.

name: Sticky Piston
description: Sticky pistons act like regular pistons (the 'arm' can be pushed forwards and backwards), but the 'sticky' substance on the arm latches onto the block that is adjacent to the arm when extended, and pulls it back when contracted.

name: Cobweb
description: Cobwebs are found in mine shafts. They can be placed inside a crafting square to yield 9 string. When inside a cobweb block, your movement is slowed.

name: Fern
description: Ferns can only be obtained when the block is broken with shears. They spawn in forest biomes. When broken, there is a chance that seeds (wheat) will be dropped.

name: Dead Bush
description: Dead bushes are found in the desert, and other biomes like mesas and mega taigas. They can only be obtained by breaking them with shears. They serve no purpose outside of being a decorative item.

name: Seagrass
description: Seagrass was introduced in Minecraft Update Aquatic. It has the same properties as regular grass, but grows underwater.

name: Sea Pickle
description: Sea pickles can be used to create lime dye. They are also light sources.

name: Piston
description: When activated with redstone, a piston will push an arm out in the direction it is facing. This arm will push the block infront of it forwards one block.

name: White Wool
description: Wool can be crafted with string, which can be obtained from sheep or spiders. Dyed wool is obtained by placing a dye and a wool block (of any colour) into the same crafting table.

name: Red Mushroom
description: The red mushroom in Minecraft is used to create mushroom stew, fermented spider eyes and rabbit stew. It can be found in swamp and mushroom biomes.

name: Block of Gold
description: The gold block in Minecraft can be used as a way to save space (it holds 9 golden ingots), or as a way to show off your wealth. It can be made by placing a golden ingot in each square of the crafting table.

name: Block of Iron
description: The iron block in Minecraft can be used as a way to save space (it holds 9 iron ingots), or as a way to show off your wealth. It can be made by placing an iron ingot in each square of the crafting table.

name: Oak Slab
description: An oak slab block can be crafted by placing 3 wooden planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

name: Spruce Slab
description: A spruce slab block can be crafted by placing 3 spruce planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

name: Birch Slab
description: A birch slab block can be crafted by placing 3 birch planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

name: Jungle Slab
description: A jungle slab block can be crafted by placing 3 jungle planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

name: Acacia Slab
description: An acacia slab block can be crafted by placing 3 acacia planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

name: Dark Oak Slab
description: A dark oak slab block can be crafted by placing 3 dark oak planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

name: Stone Slab
description: Wooden slabs are crafted by placing 3 wooden planks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Sandstone Slab
description: Sandstone slabs are crafted by placing 3 sandstone blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Petrified Oak Slab
description: This is a regular oak slab that is non-flammable. This item was removed when slabs were updated to become flammable in 1.3.1 (replaced with a flammable version of this item), it was reintroduced as the petrified oak slab in Minecraft 1.13.

name: Cobblestone Slab
description: Cobblestone slabs are crafted by placing 3 cobblestone blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Brick Slab
description: Brick slabs are crafted by placing 3 bricks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Stone Brick Slab
description: Stonebrick slabs are crafted by placing 3 stone bricks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Nether Brick Slab
description: Netherbrick slabs are crafted by placing 3 nether bricks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Quartz Slab
description: Quartz slabs are crafted by placing 3 quartz blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Red Sandstone Slab
description: Red sandstone slabs are crafted by placing 3 red sandstone blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Purpur Slab
description: Purpur slabs are crafted by placing 3 purpur blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Prismarine Slab
description: This block has all of the same properties as a prismarine block, but is half its height. It was introduced in 1.13 and can be crafted by placing 3 prismarine blocks next to each other (3x1) in a crafting table.

name: Prismarine Brick Slab
description: This block has all of the same properties as prismarine bricks, but is half its height. It was introduced in 1.13 and can be crafted by placing 3 prismarine brick (blocks) next to each other (3x1) in a crafting table.

name: Dark Prismarine Slab
description: This block has all of the same properties as a dark prismarine block, but is half its height. It was introduced in 1.13 and can be crafted by placing 3 dark prismarine blocks next to each other (3x1) in a crafting table.

name: Smooth Quartz
description: Double quartz slabs are created when two quartz slabs are placed on top of eachother. They cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft (although can be created as a block in the world).

properties.recipes_used_in: Smooth Quartz Stairs, Smooth Quartz Slab

name: Smooth Red Sandstone
description: Smooth red sandstone is a decorative block that can be made using normal red sandstone.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smooth Red Sandstone Stairs, Smooth Red Sandstone Slab

name: Smooth Sandstone
description: Smooth red sandstone is a decorative block that can be made using normal red sandstone.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smooth Sandstone Stairs, Smooth Sandstone Slab

name: Smooth Stone
description: The smooth double stone slab, with no edges cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft, or spawned into your inventory. It is a decorative item that must be spawned using WorldEdit. The image pictured below is incorrect (this item is the smooth stone slab so there is no line in between the two slabs).

name: Bricks
description: The brick block can be crafted in Minecraft by placing 4 bricks in the crafting table. It is used primarily as a decorative block, and can be used to make banners.

properties.recipes_used_in: Brick Slab, Brick Stairs, Brick Wall

name: TNT
description: TNT can be crafted by placing sand and gunpowder in the crafting table. The gunpowder should be in the middle and each corner, with sand in the empty slots. When ignited with flint and steel, or a fire arrow, it explodes and does damage to surrounding blocks.

name: Bookshelf
description: Bookshelves can be crafted by placing 3 books in the vertical middle slots of the crafting table, and wooden blocks of any colour in the remaining 6 slots. When placed around enchantment tables, they increase the maximum level of enchantment the table can provide. They can also be used as a fuel in furnaces, although this isn't recommended as it isn't the most efficient fuel.. unless you hate libraries!

name: Mossy Cobblestone
description: Moss stone is only dropped when the block is mined with a pickaxe. It can be crafted by placing a vine and a cobblestone block into the crafting table.

properties.recipes_used_in: Mossy Cobblestone Wall, Mossy Cobblestone Stairs, Mossy Cobblestone Slab

name: Obsidian
description: Obsidian is created when water meets lava. It is one of the only blocks that will withstand an explosion in Minecraft. It cannot be crafted and must be mined with a diamond pickaxe.

name: Torch
description: Torches in Minecraft are a primary light source. They can be crafted by placing a stick and a piece of coal on top in the crafting table.

name: End Rod
description: The end rod is a decorative Minecraft item that can be used as a light source, it also emits white particles around it. It can be made using a blaze rod and popped chorus fruit.

name: Chorus Plant
description: The chorus plant block can only be found in the end, specifically on the outer islands. It is used to grow popped chorus fruit, which is an essential ingredient for crafting recipes for items such as the end rod.

name: Chorus Flower
description: The chorus flower is a flower/fruit that grows on the chorus plant, which can be found in the end. Unlike regular Minecraft flowers, they must be planted on end stone, not dirt.

name: Purpur Block
description: The purpur block in Minecraft is a solely decorative item that can be found in the end world. They must be mined with a pickaxe. They can also be crafted using popped chorus fruit.

name: Purpur Pillar
description: The purpur pillar is a decorative variant of the purpur block. It can be made using two purpur slabs.

name: Purpur Stairs
description: Purpur stairs can be made by placing 6 purpur blocks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Spawner
description: Mob spawners, or monster spawners, are blocks that spawn mobs when placed. Conditions (e.g. light levels) relative to the mob type of the spawner must still be met in order for the monster to spawn. They are often used in grinders, and can be found in dungeons but cannot be mined in Vanilla Minecraft.

name: Oak Stairs
description: Oak wood stairs can be made by placing 6 oak wooden planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Chest
description: Chests in Minecraft are used to store items. To craft a chest, place one wooden plank in every outer square of the crafting table, leaving the middle empty. To open a chest, right click the chest block. When broken, the contents of a chest will be dropped on the floor. A chest has 27 slots, this can be increased to 54 by making placing a second chest next to the chest block, which forms a double chest.

properties.recipes_used_in: Trapped Chest, Hopper, Shulker Box, Minecart with Chest

name: Diamond Ore
description: Diamond ore generates below Y 16 in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken with an iron or diamond pickaxe, a single diamond item is dropped. If broken with a silk touch enchanted pickaxe, the diamond ore block will be dropped.

name: Block of Diamond
description: Diamond blocks are crafted by placing 9 diamond items inside the crafting table (one in each square). They can be used to power beacons, or as a way to save chest space.

name: Crafting Table
description: Crafting tables are one of the most important items in Minecraft. They are used for most crafting recipes as the inventory crafting square is only 2x2. To make a crafting bench, place 4 wooden planks in a 2x2 formation in a crafting square.

name: Farmland
description: The hoed dirt/soil/grass block, otherwise known as 'farmland', cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. The block is formed when grass or dirt is right clicked with a hoe.

name: Furnace
description: The burning furnace is a block that cannot be added to your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. The block is formed when fuel and an item to smelt are placed together in a regular furnace, and will drop a regular furnace item along with the contents of the furnace if broken.

properties.recipes_used_in: Minecart with Furnace, Smoker, Blast Furnace

name: Ladder
description: The ladder item can be used to create ladders in Minecraft. Simply right click the ladder on the outer face of a block to place it. When you walk into a ladder block, you move upwards. If you stop walking forwards, whilst in the same square as a ladder block, you will move down the ladder. You do not take fall damage when you reach the bottom of a ladder.

name: Rail
description: A rail is an item that can carry minecarts. It can be crafted with iron ingots and wooden planks. In can also be found in mineshafts, which are structures that generate naturally in Minecraft.

name: Cobblestone Stairs
description: Cobblestone stairs can be made by placing 6 cobblestone blocks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Lever
description: A lever can be crafted with a stone block and wooden stick. When right clicked, it will switch upwards or downwards (relative to whether it is currently switched upwards or downwards). It is useful for redstone circuits, and can be used to activate things like iron doors.

name: Stone Pressure Plate
description: The stone pressure plate can be crafted by placing two stone blocks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of. This block must be placed on top of a block, and will break if the block below it is broken.

name: Oak Pressure Plate
description: The wooden pressure plate can be crafted by placing two wooden planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of. This block must be placed on top of a block, and will break if the block below it is broken.

name: Spruce Pressure Plate
description: The spruce pressure plate can be crafted by placing two spruce planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

name: Birch Pressure Plate
description: The birch pressure plate can be crafted by placing birch wooden planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

name: Jungle Pressure Plate
description: The jungle pressure plate can be crafted by placing two jungle planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

name: Acacia Pressure Plate
description: The acacia pressure plate can be crafted by placing two acacia planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

name: Dark Oak Pressure Plate
description: The dark oak pressure plate can be crafted by placing two dark oak planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

name: Redstone Ore
description: Glowing redstone ore is the block used to create the 'glowing effect' redstone ore sometimes has. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft.

name: Redstone Torch
description: This is the block that takes the place of a redstone torch when it is switched on.

properties.recipes_used_in: Activator Rail, Redstone Repeater, Redstone Comparator

name: Stone Button
description: The stone button is similar to the lever, in the sense that it can be used to activate/deactivate a redstone circuit. It is different because it will only 'activate' for 1 second after being pushed.

name: Snow
description: The snow block in Minecraft spawns in ice plains, ice spikes, cold taiga, frozen river and cold beach biomes.

name: Ice
description: Ice spawns and spreads in cold environments in Minecraft. When broken with an item that has the silk touch enchantment, an ice block is dropped. When broken with any other item, nothing is dropped and the block turns into water.

name: Snow Block
description: The snow block in Minecraft spawns in ice plains, ice spikes, cold taiga, frozen river and cold beach biomes. If broken with a shovel that has the silk touch enchantment, the block is dropped. If broken with any regular shovel, snowballs are dropped. If broken with an item that isn't a shovel, nothing is dropped.

name: Cactus
description: In Minecraft, when a mob or player walks into a cactus, they take half a heart of damage every second. When broken, the cactus drops itself on the floor. If the 'base' cactus of a cactus that is taller than one block is broken, all cacti blocks above are also broken.

name: Clay
description: A random quantity of the clay item is dropped when a clay block is broken (found underwater in rivers and oceans). Clay can be used to make bricks and clay blocks.

name: Jukebox
description: The jukebox is the block and item that is used to play music discs in Minecraft.

name: Oak Fence
description: Fences in Minecraft are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft an oak fence, place 4 oak planks and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

name: Spruce Fence
description: Spruce fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

name: Birch Fence
description: Birch fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

name: Jungle Fence
description: Jungle fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

name: Acacia Fence
description: Acacia fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

name: Dark Oak Fence
description: Dark oak fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

name: Pumpkin
description: Pumpkins are the block that grow from pumpkin seeds in Minecraft. They cannot be crafted, but yield 4 pumpkin seeds when placed into the crafting table. As of 1.13, this item does not have a face carved into it. The new carved pumpkin block does, however.

name: Carved Pumpkin
description: The carved pumpkin is the same as a regular pumpkin, but has the 'carved face' texture from versions before 1.13. It can be made by clicking on a regular pumpkin with shears.

name: Netherrack
description: Netherrack cannot be crafted in Vanilla Minecraft. It is the primarily building block of the nether. It can be broken very fast with a pickaxe. When broken, it drops the netherrack item.

name: Soul Sand
description: Your speed is reduced when walking over a soul sand block. The block can be used to create one-way doors in Minecraft. Soul sand cannot be crafted, but generates naturally in the nether.

name: Glowstone
description: Glowstone is one of the brightest and strongest light sources in Minecraft. It emits light at a level of 15. When broken without a silk touch pickaxe, it drops 2-4 glowstone dust. It can be crafted by placing glowstone dust in the crafting table in a 2x2 formation.

name: Jack o'Lantern
description: Jack o'Lanterns are exactly the same as pumpkins in Minecraft. The only difference is that they emit light. They can be crafted by placing a pumpkin and a torch in the crafting table together.

name: Oak Trapdoor
description: Trapdoors in Minecraft act like vertical doors (they open upwards). They are only 1 block in size. They are very useful for redstone contraptions.

name: Spruce Trapdoor
description: The spruce trapdoor can be crafted using 6 spruce planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

name: Birch Trapdoor
description: The birch trapdoor can be crafted using 6 birch planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

name: Jungle Trapdoor
description: The jungle trapdoor can be crafted using 6 jungle planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

name: Acacia Trapdoor
description: The acacia trapdoor can be crafted using 6 acacia planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

name: Dark Oak Trapdoor
description: The dark oak trapdoor can be crafted using 6 dark oak planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

name: Infested Stone
description: The stone monster egg block has the exact same properties as the stone block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

name: Infested Cobblestone
description: The cobblestone monster egg block has the exact same properties as the cobblestone block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

name: Infested Stone Bricks
description: The stone brick monster egg block has the exact same properties as the stone brick block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

name: Infested Mossy Stone Bricks
description: The mossy stone brick monster egg block has the exact same properties as the mossy stone brick block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

name: Infested Cracked Stone Bricks
description: The cracked stone brick monster egg block has the exact same properties as the cracked stone brick block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

name: Infested Chiseled Stone Bricks
description: The chiseled stone brick monster egg block has the exact same properties as the chiseled stone brick block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

name: Stone Bricks
description: Stone bricks in Minecraft are solely decorative blocks as they have no useful function in Vanilla Minecraft.

properties.recipes_used_in: Stone Brick Slab, Mossy Stone Bricks, Stone Brick Stairs, Stone Brick Wall

name: Mossy Stone Bricks
description: Mossy stone bricks in Minecraft are solely decorative blocks as they have no useful function in Vanilla Minecraft.

properties.recipes_used_in: Mossy Stone Brick Wall, Mossy Stone Brick Stairs, Mossy Stone Brick Slab

name: Cracked Stone Bricks
description: Cracked stone bricks in Minecraft are solely decorative blocks as they have no useful function in Vanilla Minecraft.

name: Chiseled Stone Bricks
description: Chiseled stone bricks in Minecraft are solely decorative blocks as they have no useful function in Vanilla Minecraft.

name: Brown Mushroom Block
description: The brown mushroom block is a constituent of trees found in mushroom biomes. When broken, it sometimes drops mushrooms. The block itself will only be dropped when broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment.

name: Red Mushroom Block
description: The red mushroom block is a constituent of trees found in mushroom biomes. When broken, it sometimes drops mushrooms. The block itself will only be dropped when broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment.

name: Mushroom Stem
description: The mushroom stem is the block that makes up the 'logs' of the mushroom tree in Minecraft. It was added in Minecraft 1.13 as an obtainable item.

name: Iron Bars
description: Iron bars, also known as iron fences, do not act like regular fences as they can be jumped over. To craft 16 iron bars, place an iron ingot in the 2 bottom rows of the crafting table (6 total iron ingots).

name: Glass Pane
description: The glass pane is similar to the glass block, in the sense that it is transparent. Glass panes can be crafted by placing a glass block in each of the 2 bottom rows of the crafting table (6 total glass).

properties.recipes_used_in: White Stained Glass Pane, Orange Stained Glass Pane, Magenta Stained Glass Pane, Light Blue Stained Glass Pane, Yellow Stained Glass Pane, Lime Stained Glass Pane, Pink Stained Glass Pane, Gray Stained Glass Pane, Light Gray Stained Glass Pane, Cyan Stained Glass Pane, Purple Stained Glass Pane, Blue Stained Glass Pane, Brown Stained Glass Pane, Green Stained Glass Pane, Red Stained Glass Pane, Black Stained Glass Pane

name: Melon
description: The melon block is the block that is formed when a melon plant finished growing. When broken, it will drop 3-7 sliced melons. To obtain the melon block (not the slices), the block must be broken with a silk touch enchanted item.

name: Vines
description: Vines have the same mechanics as ladders. They can only be placed on one of the 4 outer faces of a block. They are an essential crafting ingedient for mossy cobblestone and mossy stone bricks.

name: Oak Fence Gate
description: Oak fence gates are 1 block in size (they cannot be jumped over) and act exactly like doors. They can be attached to fences and activated by redstone. They are useful to stop mobs from escaping mob farms.

name: Spruce Fence Gate
description: Spruce fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

name: Birch Fence Gate
description: Birch fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

name: Jungle Fence Gate
description: Jungle fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

name: Acacia Fence Gate
description: Acacia fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

name: Dark Oak Fence Gate
description: Dark oak fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

name: Brick Stairs
description: Brick stairs are a decorative block in Minecraft. They can be made using 6 brick blocks.

name: Stone Brick Stairs
description: Stone brick stairs are a decorative block in Minecraft. They can be made using 6 stone brick blocks.

name: Mycelium
description: Mycelium is a block that can be found in mushroom biomes, and can only be obtained when broken with a tool that has the silk touch enchantment. When placed near grass blocks, it may spread to them. It is useful for growing mushrooms.

name: Lily Pad
description: Lily pads are item in Minecraft that can be placed on top of water. They are useful as they can act as stepping stones that do not take up much room. They cannot be crafted, but naturally generate on water in biomes.

name: Nether Bricks
description: Nether brick blocks can be found inside nether fortresses. They can also be crafted using, you guessed it.. nether bricks! The block is immune to the ghast fireball.

properties.recipes_used_in: Nether Brick Slab, Nether Brick Fence, Nether Brick Stairs, Nether Brick Wall

name: Nether Brick Fence
description: Nether brick fences in Minecraft are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft a netherbrick fence, place 6 nether brick blocks in the crafting table.

name: Nether Brick Stairs
description: The nether wart block is the block that takes the place of nether wart when it is right clicked on the ground. It can only be placed on soul sand. When broken, it drops the nether wart item.

name: Enchanting Table
description: The enchanting table in Minecraft is a very useful item. It is used to enchant items, tools and armour with enchantments such as the silk touch and sharpness enchantment. The crafting recipe consists of 2 diamonds, 4 obsidian blocks and 1 book.

name: End Portal Frame
description: The end portal frame in Minecraft cannot be crafted. They are indestructible in the survival and adventure gamemodes. They generate inside strongholds and are used as a gateway to the end in Minecraft. They emit a light level of 1 and can be used as a component of redstone circuits.

name: End Stone
description: End stone is the main building block in the end. It can be broken almost instantly with a pickaxe. The item itself can only be found (in plentiful quantities) in the end, it cannot be crafted. It can be used to craft end stone bricks.

name: End Stone Bricks
description: End stone bricks are a decorative variant of end stone. They can be made by placing 4 endstone in a 2x2 formation in the crafting table.

properties.recipes_used_in: End Stone Brick Wall, End Stone Brick Stairs, End Stone Brick Slab

name: Dragon Egg
description: The dragon egg in Minecraft can be found in the end. It is dropped when the ender dragon is defeated and cannot be mined if there are free air blocks around it for it to move to.

name: Redstone Lamp
description: This is the block that takes the place of a redstone lamp when it is switched on.

name: Sandstone Stairs
description: Sandstone stairs can be made by placing 6 sandstone blocks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Emerald Ore
description: Emerald ore, when broken with a pickaxe, drops the emerald item. To obtain the emerald ore block, the block must be mined with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. The block itself only generates naturally in Minecraft inside the extreme hills biome.

name: Ender Chest
description: Enderchests are very useful items in Minecraft. They act as universal chests - the contents of the chest are player specific, and will be the same (relative to the player), regardless of what enderchest is being opened. It has 27 slots.

name: Tripwire Hook
description: Tripwire hooks in Minecraft are used to create tripwires, which can be used in redstone circuits to detect entities.

name: Block of Emerald
description: The emerald block, also known as a block of emerald, in Minecraft can be crafted by placing an emerald in each square of the crafting table. It can be used in beacons are as a way to store emeralds more efficiently (as it can be exchanged for exactly 9 emeralds again by placing it in a crafting table).

name: Spruce Stairs
description: Spruce wood stairs can be made by placing 6 spruce wood planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Birch Stairs
description: Birch wood stairs can be made by placing 6 birch wood planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Jungle Stairs
description: Jungle wood stairs can be made by placing 6 jungle wood planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Command Block
description: The command block in Minecraft can be used to execute commands. They cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC but, by using the item id, you can spawn the command block item into your inventory when in creative mode. In many cases, you must be a server op to use the block. Modifiers such as @p and @e can be used to target things like players and entities with commands.

name: Beacon
description: The beacon block in Minecraft can be used to give nearby players potion effects. Blocks under the beacon in a 'pyramid' formation can be used to give the beacon more power and/or distance. It also emits light at a level of 15 (the highest possible level for a light source).

name: Cobblestone Wall
description: Cobblestone walls act like fences (they cannot be jumped over). They have a higher durability and will not be dropped if they are mined without a pickaxe.

name: Mossy Cobblestone Wall
description: Mossy cobblestone walls act like fences (they cannot be jumped over). They have a higher durability and will not be dropped if they are mined without a pickaxe.

name: Oak Button
description: The wooden button is similar to the lever, in the sense that it can be used to activate/deactivate a redstone circuit. It is different because it will only 'activate' for 1 second after being pushed.

name: Spruce Button
description: A spruce button can be crafted by placing 1 spruce plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

name: Birch Button
description: A birch button can be crafted by placing 1 birch plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

name: Jungle Button
description: A jungle button can be crafted by placing 1 jungle plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

name: Acacia Button
description: An acacia button can be crafted by placing 1 acacia plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

name: Dark Oak Button
description: A dark oak button can be crafted by placing 1 dark oak plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

name: Anvil
description: Anvils are very useful items in Minecraft. They can be used to repair items and merge enchantments. They require exp and a lot of iron to make. With use, the durability of this item/block decreases and it will eventually break if not repaired.

name: Chipped Anvil
description: This is the block that takes the place of a slightly damaged anvil in Minecraft.

name: Damaged Anvil
description: This is the block that takes the place of a severely damaged anvil in Minecraft.

name: Trapped Chest
description: The trapped chest item produces redstone power when it is opened. For this reason, it is very useful in redstone circuits.

name: Light Weighted Pressure Plate
description: Weighted pressure plates useful items in redstone circuits. They act just like normal wooden and stone pressure plates, but activate based on the amount of weight placed on them. This means they may not activate when an item is placed on them.

name: Heavy Weighted Pressure Plate
description: Weighted pressure plates useful items in redstone circuits. They act just like normal wooden and stone pressure plates, but activate based on the amount of weight placed on them. This means they may not activate when an item is placed on them.

name: Daylight Detector
description: Inverted daylight sensors act in a similar way to regular daylight sensors, they simply provide a current when it is dark, rather than when it is light.

name: Block of Redstone
description: The redstone block, also known as a block of redstone, in Minecraft can be crafted by placing redstone dust in each square of the crafting table. It is used in redstone circuits as it has special functions, and does not act like redstone dust. It can also be used to store redstone more efficiently (as it can be exchanged for exactly 9 redstone again by placing it in a crafting table).

name: Nether Quartz Ore
description: Nether quartz ore is found between Y 7 and Y 117 in the nether region in Minecraft. When broken with any pickaxe, it drops the nether quartz item.

name: Hopper
description: Hoppers are very useful items as they can pick up items dropped above them and transfer them to chests. Hoppers are often used in redstone circuits and/or mob farms/grinders.

name: Chiseled Quartz Block
description: The chiseled quartz block is almost exactly the same as the quartz block. The only difference is the texture.

name: Block of Quartz
description: The nether quartz block, also known as a block of quartz, in Minecraft can be crafted by placing a quartz in each square of the crafting table. It can be used as a way to store quartz more efficiently (as it can be exchanged for exactly 9 quartz again by placing it in a crafting table).

name: Quartz Pillar
description: The pillar quartz block is almost exactly the same as the quartz block. The only difference is the texture.

name: Quartz Stairs
description: Quartz stairs can be made by placing 5 quartz blocks, and 1 chiseled quartz block, in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Activator Rail
description: Activator rails do as the name would suggest - they activate when a minecart passes over them. They are useful for detecting minecarts in redstone circuits.

name: Dropper
description: Droppers in Minecraft are used as a redstone component to move items, and also deposit them into containers such as chests.

name: Turtle Egg
description: This egg will hatch into a baby turtle (only at night) after going through all stages of growth/development. It can be obtained if broken with a silk touch pickaxe.

name: Dead Tube Coral Block
description: This block is obtained when a tube coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

name: Dead Brain Coral Block
description: This block is obtained when a brain coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

name: Dead Bubble Coral Block
description: This block is obtained when a bubble coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

name: Dead Fire Coral Block
description: This block is obtained when a fire coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

name: Dead Horn Coral Block
description: This block is obtained when a horn coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

name: Tube Coral Block
description: The tube coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

name: Brain Coral Block
description: The brain coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

name: Bubble Coral Block
description: The bubble coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

name: Fire Coral Block
description: The fire coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

name: Horn Coral Block
description: The horn coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

name: Tube Coral
description: Tube coral is a blue colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

name: Brain Coral
description: Brain coral is a pink colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

name: Bubble Coral
description: Bubble coral is a purple colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

name: Fire Coral
description: Fire coral is a red colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

name: Horn Coral
description: Horn coral is a yellow colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

name: Tube Coral Fan
description: Tube coral fans have similar properties to tube coral - they are blue, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

name: Brain Coral Fan
description: Brain coral fans have similar properties to brain coral - they are pink, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

name: Bubble Coral Fan
description: Bubble coral fans have similar properties to bubble coral - they are purple, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

name: Fire Coral Fan
description: Fire coral fans have similar properties to fire coral - they are red, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

name: Horn Coral Fan
description: Horn coral fans have similar properties to horn coral - they are yellow, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

name: Blue Ice
description: Blue ice is an item similar to packed ice - it can be crafted by placing a packed ice block in each square of the crafting table. It will not melt near light sources and allows for faster sliding of items, boats, water currents, etc.

name: Conduit
description: This item can be crafted with 8 nautilus shells and 1 heart of the sea. It will give players the conduit power status effect.

name: Iron Door
description: The iron door item can be made with iron ingots. When placed, the door can only be opened with buttons/levers, and not by right clicking.

name: Oak Door
description: When placed, this item becomes the door block, which can be open/closed to stop mobs, etc from entering an area. To open/close a door, simply right click it.

name: Spruce Door
description: Dark oak doors in Minecraft can be both opened and closed. They are two blocks in height. To place a door, right click the door item on the ground. If the supporting block underneath a door is broken, the door will also break.

name: Birch Door
description: Birch doors in Minecraft can be both opened and closed. They are two blocks in height. To place a door, right click the door item on the ground. If the supporting block underneath a door is broken, the door will also break.

name: Jungle Door
description: The jungle door block is created when an jungle door item is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops the door item.

name: Acacia Door
description: The acacia door block is created when an acacia door item is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops the door item.

name: Dark Oak Door
description: The dark oak door block is created when an dark oak door item is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops the door item.

name: Redstone Repeater
description: Redstone repeaters can be used to delay a redstone signal, useful for creating repeating circuits and complex redstone circuits in Minecraft.

name: Redstone Comparator
description: A redstone comparator can be used to change the strength of a redstone signal. It can also be used to measure things like container fullness and compare signal strengths.

name: Structure Block
description: Structure blocks are a non-Vanilla Minecraft item that can be used to generate structures.

name: Turtle Shell
description: This item can be crafted by placing 5 scutes in a crafting table (in a helmet shape). It will give the wielder the water breathing potion effect when worn underwater.

name: Scute
description: Scutes are dropped by baby turtles when they grow into adults. They are used to craft turtle shell helmets.

name: Iron Shovel
description: Iron shovels require 1 iron ingot to craft. They can break dirt, sand, gravel and other similar blocks at a faster rate than lower-level shovels.

name: Iron Pickaxe
description: Iron pickaxes require 3 iron ingots to craft. They are required to mine diamonds, and mine other blocks like stone, cobblestone, and ores at a faster rate than lower-level pickaxes.

name: Iron Axe
description: Iron axes (hatchet) are used to cut wooden items like planks, logs, slabs, etc rate at a faster rate. They require 3 iron ingots to craft.

name: Flint and Steel
description: Flint and steel can be made with flint and iron. The item is used to create fire in Minecraft, by right clicking a block.

name: Apple
description: Apples can be eaten, or used to create golden apples and notch/god apples. Apples have a 1 in 200 chance of being dropped when leaves decay, or are broken.

name: Bow
description: Bows are used to shoot arrows in Minecraft. When the arrow hits an entity, it causes damage. They are also required to make dispensers.

name: Arrow
description: Arrows are used as ammunition for bows. They can also be used in dispensers. When they collide with a damageable mob/entity, they cause damage. They can also activate things like pressure plates.

name: Coal
description: Coal is obtained when coal ore is mined in Minecraft. Coal can be used to create coal blocks, or as a fuel in a furnace to smelt items.

properties.recipes_used_in: Torch, Block of Coal, Fire Charge, Campfire, Soul Torch

name: Charcoal
description: Charcoal in Minecraft is used as a fuel, just like regular coal. It could be considered superior can be made with logs, so you do not need to mine coal to use it as a fuel.

properties.recipes_used_in: Torch, Fire Charge, Campfire, Soul Torch

name: Diamond
description: Diamonds are perhaps Minecraft's most famous item. They can be used to make diamond armour, weapons and tools - as well as blocks like enchantment tables. They are obtained when diamond ore is mined.

properties.recipes_used_in: Block of Diamond, Jukebox, Enchanting Table, Diamond Sword, Diamond Shovel, Diamond Pickaxe, Diamond Axe, Diamond Hoe, Diamond Helmet, Diamond Chestplate, Diamond Leggings, Diamond Boots

name: Iron Ingot
description: Iron ingots are obtained when iron ore is smelted with fuel in a furnace. Iron ingots are an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes including iron tools, weapons and armour - along with things like iron doors and anvils.

properties.recipes_used_in: Detector Rail, Piston, Block of Iron, Rail, Iron Bars, Tripwire Hook, Anvil, Heavy Weighted Pressure Plate, Hopper, Activator Rail, Iron Trapdoor, Iron Door, Iron Shovel, Iron Pickaxe, Iron Axe, Flint and Steel, Iron Sword, Iron Hoe, Iron Helmet, Iron Chestplate, Iron Leggings, Iron Boots, Bucket, Minecart, Compass, Shears, Cauldron, Shield, Iron Nugget, Crossbow, Blast Furnace, Smithing Table, Stonecutter, Chain

name: Gold Ingot
description: Golden ingots are obtained when gold ore is smelted with fuel in a furnace. They can be converted into golden nuggets, or used to create golden armour, tools and weapons. Golden ingots can also be used to make golden apples and are used in other crafting recipes.

properties.recipes_used_in: Powered Rail, Block of Gold, Light Weighted Pressure Plate, Golden Sword, Golden Shovel, Golden Pickaxe, Golden Axe, Golden Hoe, Golden Helmet, Golden Chestplate, Golden Leggings, Golden Boots, Golden Apple, Clock, Gold Nugget, Netherite Ingot

name: Iron Sword
description: Iron swords can be crafted using two iron ingots and a stick in Minecraft. They deal more damage to mobs and other entities than lower-leveled swords and weapons.

name: Wooden Sword
description: Wood swords in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden planks and 1 wooden stick. They are the least powerful sword, but still deal more damage to mobs and entities than your bare hands would, and can be enchanted.

name: Wooden Shovel
description: Wood shovels in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 1 wooden plank. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still break dirt, sand, gravel, etc faster than your bare hands.

name: Wooden Pickaxe
description: Wood pickaxes in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 wooden planks. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still mine stone, cobblestone, etc faster than your bare hands.

name: Wooden Axe
description: Wood axes (hatchet) in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 wooden planks. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still break wooden blocks and logs faster than your bare hands.

name: Stone Sword
description: Stone swords are the 2nd least powerful swords in Minecraft. They are easy to make: 1 stick and 2 cobblestone is required and deal a considerable amount of damage to mobs and other entities.

name: Stone Shovel
description: Stone shovels can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 1 cobblestone/stone block. Whilst stone tools are the 2nd weakest tool in Minecraft, they are a massive step up from wooden tools in both durability and the time they take to break blocks.

name: Stone Pickaxe
description: Stone pickaxes can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 cobblestone/stone blocks. They are the lowest level of tool that can mine iron ore.

name: Stone Axe
description: Stone axes (hatchet) can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 cobblestone/stone blocks. They can break wooden blocks much faster than wooden tools and your bare hands, but are still the 2nd weakest tool for breaking wood in Minecraft.

name: Diamond Sword
description: Diamond swords are the most powerful weapon in Minecraft. They can be crafted using 2 diamonds and 1 wooden stick. They can also be enchanted and found in villages/dungeons.

name: Diamond Shovel
description: Diamond shovels can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 1 diamond. They are the fastest tool for breaking dirt, sand, gravel, etc in Minecraft.

name: Diamond Pickaxe
description: Diamond pickaxes are the only pickaxe that can break obsidian in Minecraft. They can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 diamonds. They are the fastest tool for mining stone, ores, etc in Minecraft.

name: Diamond Axe
description: Diamond axes can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 diamonds in Minecraft. They are the fastest tool for breaking wood, logs and other wooden items in the game.

name: Stick
description: Sticks can be made using 2 wooden planks. They are required for all crafting recipes involving tools and weapons.

name: Bowl
description: Bowls can be crafted using 3 wooden planks in Minecraft. They are used in crafting recipes for item such as mushroom stew, rabbit stew and beetroot soup.

properties.recipes_used_in: Mushroom Stew, Rabbit Stew, Beetroot Soup

name: Mushroom Stew
description: Mushroom stew in Minecraft can be made using 1 red mushroom, 1 brown mushroom and 1 bowl.

name: Golden Sword
description: In Minecraft, golden swords can be made using 1 wooden stick and 2 golden ingots. They have a very low durability.

name: Golden Shovel
description: Golden shovels can be made using 2 wooden sticks and 1 golden ingot. They are faster than wooden shovels, but have a very low durability.

name: Golden Pickaxe
description: Golden pickaxes can be made using 2 wooden sticks and 3 golden ingots. They are faster than wooden pickaxes, but have a very low durability.

name: Golden Axe
description: Golden axes (hatchet) can be made using 2 wooden sticks and 3 golden ingots. They are faster than wooden axes, but have a very low durability.

name: String
description: String in Minecraft can be made using wool. It is also dropped from spiders. It is essential for making many items such as bows.

properties.recipes_used_in: White Wool, Bow, Fishing Rod, Lead, Scaffolding, Crossbow, Loom

name: Feather
description: Feathers can be used to make items such as arrows and books and quills. They are dropped by chickens and parrots.

name: Gunpowder
description: Gun powder is used to make TNT in Minecraft. It is dropped by creepers when they are killed and do not explode.

name: Wooden Hoe
description: Wood hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 wooden planks. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

name: Stone Hoe
description: Stone hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 stone/cobblestone blocks. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

name: Iron Hoe
description: Iron hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 iron ignots. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

name: Diamond Hoe
description: Diamond hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 diamonds. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

name: Golden Hoe
description: Golden hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 golden ingots. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

name: Wheat Seeds
description: Wheat seeds are the item that is used to plant wheat in Minecraft. They can be obtained from grass (when it is broken) and planted on hoed land by right click.

name: Wheat
description: Wheat in Minecraft can be obtained from seeds, when they are fully grown. It is also found in dungeons and villagers. Wheat is used to make bread.

name: Bread
description: Bread is a food (satiates hunger) that can be made with 3 pieces of wheat.

name: Leather Cap
description: Leather helmets in Minecraft can be made with 5 pieces of leather. They are the lowest level head armor in the game.

name: Leather Tunic
description: Leather tunics in Minecraft can be made with 8 pieces of leather. They are the lowest level chestplate in the game.

name: Leather Pants
description: Leather leggings in Minecraft can be made with 7 pieces of leather. They are the lowest level leg armor in the game.

name: Leather Boots
description: Leather boots in Minecraft can be made with 4 pieces of leather. They are the lowest level foot armor in the game.

name: Chainmail Helmet
description: Chainmail helmets can be found in dungeons in Minecraft. Chainmail armor is slightly weaker than iron, and cannot be crafted.

name: Chainmail Chestplate
description: Chainmail chestplates can be found in dungeons in Minecraft. Chainmail armor is slightly weaker than iron, and cannot be crafted.

name: Chainmail Leggings
description: Chainmail pants can be found in dungeons in Minecraft. Chainmail armor is slightly weaker than iron, and cannot be crafted.

name: Chainmail Boots
description: Chainmail boots can be found in dungeons in Minecraft. Chainmail armor is slightly weaker than iron, and cannot be crafted.

name: Iron Helmet
description: Iron helmets in Minecraft can be made with 5 iron ingots. They are the 2nd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Iron Chestplate
description: Iron chestplates in Minecraft can be made with 8 iron ingots. They are the 2nd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Iron Leggings
description: Iron pants in Minecraft can be made with 7 iron ingots. They are the 2nd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Iron Boots
description: Iron boots in Minecraft can be made with 4 iron ingots. They are the 2nd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Diamond Helmet
description: Diamond helmets in Minecraft can be made with 5 diamonds. They are the highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Diamond Chestplate
description: Diamond chestplates in Minecraft can be made with 8 diamonds. They are the highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Diamond Leggings
description: Diamond pants in Minecraft can be made with 7 diamonds. They are the highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Diamond Boots
description: Diamond boots in Minecraft can be made with 4 diamonds. They are the highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Golden Helmet
description: Gold helmets in Minecraft can be made with 5 golden ingots. They are the 3rd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Golden Chestplate
description: Gold chestplates in Minecraft can be made with 8 golden ingots. They are the 3rd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Golden Leggings
description: Gold pants in Minecraft can be made with 7 golden ingots. They are the 3rd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Golden Boots
description: Gold boots in Minecraft can be made with 4 golden ingots. They are the 3rd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

name: Flint
description: Flint is dropped sometimes when gravel in broken in Minecraft. It is used to make flint and steel.

properties.recipes_used_in: Flint and Steel, Arrow, Fletching Table

name: Raw Porkchop
description: Raw porkchop is dropped from pigs in Minecraft when they are killed (and not on fire). It can be cooked in a furnace to form cooked porkchop, which is a food item.

name: Cooked Porkchop
description: Cooked porkchop can be made by killing a pig whilst it is on fire, or by cooking raw porkchop in a furnace. When eaten, this item satiates your hunger.

name: Painting
description: Paintings are items in Minecraft that display a piece of artwork. The piece of art shown is random.

name: Golden Apple
description: Golden apples in Minecraft provide absorption, 2 hunger levels and the regeneration potion effect when consumed. They can be made with 8 golden ingots and 1 apple.

name: Enchanted Golden Apple
description: The enchanted golden apple, also known as the god apple, notch apple, or OP apple in Minecraft is an item that require 8 golden blocks and 1 apple to craft. It provides 30 seconds of regeneration, 2 minutes of absorption and 5 minutes of both resistance and fire resistance when consumed.

name: Sign
description: Signs in Minecraft can have 4 lines of text written on them. Right click the sign on a wall, or the ground to place it.

name: Bucket
description: A bucket is made with 3 iron ingots. It can be filled with water or lava by right clicking on a water or lava source.

name: Water Bucket
description: A water bucket can be obtained by right clicking a bucket on a water source. Water buckets are useful for moving water.

name: Lava Bucket
description: A lava bucket can be obtained by right clicking a bucket on a lava source. Lava buckets are useful for moving lava.

name: Minecart
description: A minecart can be made using 5 iron ingots. It is primarily a transportation item that can be used to move quickly across mine tracks. It also can be used to make things like hopper minecarts, which are useful for redstone circuits.

properties.recipes_used_in: Minecart with Chest, Minecart with Furnace, Minecart with TNT, Minecart with Hopper

name: Saddle
description: A saddle can be placed on a pig, horse, or any other rideable mob to.. ride it! This is useful as riding on mobs like horses is faster than sprinting!

name: Redstone
description: Redstone dust is an essential item for redstone circuits. A random number of redstone is dropped when redstone ore is broken. Redstone is also used in many different crafting recipes.

properties.recipes_used_in: Dispenser, Note Block, Powered Rail, Detector Rail, Piston, Redstone Torch, Redstone Lamp, Block of Redstone, Dropper, Observer, Redstone Repeater, Compass, Clock, Target

name: Snowball
description: Snowballs are obtained when snow is broken with any shovel. They can be thrown by right clicking them.

name: Oak Boat
description: Oak boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 oak planks, and put on water by right click.

name: Leather
description: A random amount of leather is dropped when cows are killed. Leather can be used to create leather armor, and is an essential ingredient in many other crafting recipes.

properties.recipes_used_in: Leather Cap, Leather Tunic, Leather Pants, Leather Boots, Book, Item Frame, Leather Horse Armor

name: Milk Bucket
description: Buckets of milk can be obtained by right clicking a cow with an empty bucket. They are required to make cakes.

name: Bucket of Pufferfish
description: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a pufferfish mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.

name: Bucket of Salmon
description: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a salmon mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.

name: Bucket of Cod
description: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a cod mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.

name: Bucket of Tropical Fish
description: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a tropical fish mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.

name: Brick
description: Bricks in Minecraft can be made by smelting clay in a furnace. They are used to create flower pots and bricks (block).

name: Clay
description: A random quantity of the clay item is dropped when a clay block is broken (found underwater in rivers and oceans). Clay can be used to make bricks and clay blocks.

name: Sugar Cane
description: Sugar canes can be found alongside rivers. They can only be placed on sand. When placed near an adequate water source, and there is a high light level, sugar canes will grow.

name: Kelp
description: Kelp is a plant that grows in the ocean. It can be put inside a furnace to create dried kelp, a consumable item.

name: Dried Kelp Block
description: This item can be crafted by placing a dried kelp in each square of a crafting bench (9 total). It can be used as a fuel in a furnace.

name: Paper
description: Paper can be made by placing 3 sugar cane in a vertical line in the crafting bench. It is used to create maps, books and fireworks.

properties.recipes_used_in: Book, Empty Map, Banner Pattern, Banner Pattern, Banner Pattern, Banner Pattern, Cartography Table

name: Book
description: Books in Minecraft can be made with 3 paper and 1 piece of leather. They are required to make enchantment tables, bookshelves and the book and quill item.

properties.recipes_used_in: Bookshelf, Enchanting Table, Book and Quill

name: Slimeball
description: Slimeballs in Minecraft are dropped when slimes are killed (0-2). They are used to create many items, such as magma cream and leads. They are also required to make sticky pistons, an important redstone component.

properties.recipes_used_in: Sticky Piston, Slime Block, Magma Cream, Lead

name: Minecart with Chest
description: Minecarts with chests are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with chests. They cannot take a passenger. When right clicked, they open up the chest interface to store items.

name: Minecart with Furnace
description: Minecarts with furnaces are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with furnaces inside. They cannot take a passenger. When right clicked, they open up the furnace interface to smelt and cook items.

name: Egg
description: Eggs in Minecraft are dropped by chickens (naturally, not when killed). When right clicked, they are thrown like snowballs and have a 1 in 8 chance of spawning a baby chicken. Eggs are also used to create cakes and pumpkin pies in Minecraft.

name: Compass
description: Unlike real-life compasses, Minecraft compasses point to the world spawn point. They are useful for navigation. In the nether and end, the item does not work.

name: Fishing Rod
description: Fishing rods can be made with 3 sticks and 2 pieces of string. When right clicked, they will cast a line. They can be used to fish, but there is a rare chance of finding other items. Carrots can also be added to the end of fishing rods, which can be used to move pigs around.

properties.recipes_used_in: Carrot on a Stick, Warped Fungus on a Stick

name: Clock
description: Clocks in Minecraft can be used to tell the time of day.. it'd probably be easier to just look outside!

name: Glowstone Dust
description: Glowstone dust is dropped in random amounts when glowstone is broken. It is used as a brewing ingredient, and also in some crafting recipes such as the glowstone block.

name: Raw Cod
description: Raw fish, also known as raw cod, in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.

name: Raw Salmon
description: Raw salmon in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.

name: Tropical Fish
description: Clownfish in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.

name: Pufferfish
description: Pufferfish in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.

name: Cooked Cod
description: Cooked fish, also known as cooked cod, can be obtained by cooking a raw fish in a furnace in Minecraft.

name: Cooked Salmon
description: Cooked salmon can be obtained by cooking a raw salmon in a furnace in Minecraft.

name: Ink Sac
description: Ink sacs can be obtained by killing squid in Minecraft. They are the darkest form of dye.

name: Rose Red
description: Rose red dye is a form of dye in Minecraft that can be used to change the color of blocks and items.

name: Cactus Green
description: Cactus green dye is a form of dye in Minecraft that can be used to change the color of blocks and items.

name: Cocoa Beans
description: Cocoa beans, whilst also a dye that can be used to change the color of blocks and items, is a farming item that can be used to make cookies. They can be found in jungles and grow only on jungle logs.

name: Lapis Lazuli
description: Lapis lazuli is primarily a dye, but can also be used to make lapis lazuli blocks.

name: Bone Meal
description: Bonemeal has multiple uses. It can be made by placing bones in a crafting table. It can be used as a dye (white) to color items and blocks. When right clicked on plants, seeds, or saplings, it accelerates their growth.

name: Bone
description: Bones are dropped by skeletons on when they are killed. They can be used to create bonemeal and tame wolves.

name: Sugar
description: Sugar is made by placing 1 sugar cane in the crafting table. It can be used to create fermented spider eyes, cakes and pumpkin pies.

properties.recipes_used_in: Cake, Fermented Spider Eye, Pumpkin Pie

name: Cake
description: Cakes in Minecraft are a useful form of food that can be placed on top of a block. To eat a cake, right click the placed block.

name: White Bed
description: Beds in Minecraft can be made using wool and wooden planks. When slept in at night, they fast forward time to the morning. Beds also set your spawnpoint to their location (so when you die, you respawn there).
