name: Cookie
description: Cookies can be made using 2 wheat and 1 cocoa beans. It is a cheap and simple form of food that restores 2 hunger.

name: Map
description: Maps (filled) in Minecraft can be used to get a birds eye view of the world and find your way about. They can be made using 9 paper.

name: Shears
description: Shears can be made using 2 iron ingots. They can be used to shear sheep (to obtain wool) and destroy leaves at an accelerated rate.

name: Melon Slice
description: The melon item in Minecraft is dropped when the melon block is broken without a silk touch enchented item. It is a food and restores hunger levels when consumed.

properties.recipes_used_in: Melon, Melon Seeds, Glistering Melon Slice

name: Dried Kelp
description: Dried kelp is created when regular kelp is smelted in a furnace. It can be consumed or used to create dry kelp blocks.

name: Pumpkin Seeds
description: Pumpkin seeds can be planted on hoed land in Minecraft. Under the right conditions, the seeds will grow into a pumpkin block.

name: Melon Seeds
description: Melon seeds can be planted on hoed land in Minecraft. Under the right conditions, the seeds will grow into a melon block.

name: Raw Beef
description: Raw beef in Minecraft is dropped when a cow is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create steak, which is a food item.

name: Steak
description: Cooked beef, or steak, in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw beef is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.

name: Raw Chicken
description: Raw chicken in Minecraft is dropped when a chicken is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked chicken, which is a food item.

name: Cooked Chicken
description: Cooked chicken in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw chicken is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.

name: Rotten Flesh
description: Rotten flesh in Minecraft is a 'food item' that is dropped by zombies. Rotten flesh causes food poisoning for 30 seconds when consumed. It can also be used to tame wolves and trade with villagers.

name: Ender Pearl
description: Enderpearls are dropped by endermen when they are killed. When right clicked, the will be thrown as a projectile and teleport you to the location at which they land.

name: Blaze Rod
description: Blaze rods are dropped by blazes, which can be found in the nether. They can be used to create blaze powder, brewing stands and end rods.

properties.recipes_used_in: End Rod, Blaze Powder, Brewing Stand

name: Ghast Tear
description: Ghast tears are dropped by ghasts when they are killed. They are a brewing ingredient and required to craft the end crystal.

name: Gold Nugget
description: Golden nuggets can be made by placing a gold ingot in the crafting bench. They are used to create glistering melons for brewing, and many other items in Minecraft.

properties.recipes_used_in: Gold Ingot, Glistering Melon Slice, Golden Carrot

name: Nether Wart
description: Nether warts can be farmed, and also used as a brewing and crafting ingredient. Unlike most farming product, they can only be grown on soul sand. They are used to make awkward potions.

properties.recipes_used_in: Nether Wart Block, Red Nether Bricks

name: Potion
description: This is the default item that is used for potions in Minecraft. Potions can be consumed to give potion effects, both good and bad.

name: Splash Potion
description: This is the default item that is used for splash potions in Minecraft. Splash potions will give people who are nearby to their impact when thrown a potion effect (relative to the splash potion type).

name: Lingering Potion
description: Lingering potions can be used to leave a potion effect that 'lingers' on the ground for a longer period of time that a potion like a splash potion would.

name: Awkward Potion
description: An awkward potion can be made using nether warts. It is used in the brewing recipes of many other potions, but has no other use outside of this.

name: Thick Potion
description: A thick potion can be made with glowstone dust. It does not have any use in Minecraft as-of currently.

name: Mundane Potion
description: A mundance potion can be made using many different items, including redstone, rabbits foot and many others. It currently doesn't have any use in Minecraft.

name: Regeneration Potion (0:45)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the regeneration potion effect will be applied for 45 seconds. The regeneration potion effect decreases the time it takes for your health to restore.

name: Swiftness Potion (3:00)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the swiftness potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The swiftness potion effect increases your speed and makes you run/walk faster than normal.

name: Fire Resistance Potion (3:00)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the fire resistance potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The fire resistance potion effect will prevent you from taking damage from flames and fire.

name: Poison Potion (0:45)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the poison potion effect will be applied for 45 seconds. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.. who would want to drink this?!

name: Healing Potion
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), some of your health will be restored. This potion applies the instant health effect, restoring 4 health points (2 hearts).

name: Night Vision Potion (3:00)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the night vision potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The night vision potion effect will allow you to see in the dark (so you do not need to place any light sources).

name: Weakness Potion (1:30)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the weakness potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The weakness potion effect decreases your damage output and increases the amount of damage your take from all attacks.

name: Strength Potion (3:00)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the strength effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.

name: Slowness Potion (1:30)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the slowness will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The slowness potion effect is the exact opposite of the swiftness potion effect, and reduces the speed at which you can walk and run.

name: Harming Potion
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), your character will take damage. The potion will give you the instant damage potion effect, which causes you to take 6 points (3 hearts) of damage.

name: Water Breathing Potion (3:00)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the water breathing potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The water breathing potion effect allows you to 'breath underwater'. This means you won't take any damage from lack of breath whilst underwater whilst the potion effect is still active.

name: Invisibility Potion (3:00)
description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the invisibility potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The invisibility potion effect, as the name would suggest, makes you invisible.

The swiftness (speed) potion effect increases your speed and makes you run/walk faster than normal.

name: Poison II Splash (0:16) Potion
description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply up to 16 seconds of the poison 2 potion effect to nearby entities. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.

name: Healing II Splash Potion
description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply the instant health 2 effect to nearby entities. Instant health heals up to 8 health points (4 hearts).

name: Strength II Splash (1:07) Potion
description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply up to 1 minute and 7 seconds of the strength 2 potion effect to nearby entities. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.

name: Leaping II Splash (1:07) Potion
description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply up to 1 minute and 7 seconds of the jump boost 2 potion effect to nearby entities. The leaping potion effect makes your character jump higher than it can normally.

name: Harming II Splash Potion
description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply the instant damage 2 effect to nearby entities. The instant damage II potion effect causes you to take 12 points (6 hearts) of damage.

name: Regeneration Splash (1:30) Potion
description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply up to 1 minute and 30 seconds of the regeneration potion effect to nearby entities. The regeneration potion effect decreases the time it takes for your health to restore.

name: Swiftness Splash (6:00) Potion

name: Fire Resistance Splash (6:00) Potion

name: Poison Splash (1:30) Potion

The night vision potion effect will allow you to see in the dark (so you do not need to place any light sources).

name: Weakness Splash (3:00) Potion

name: Strength Splash (6:00) Potion

The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.

name: Slowness Splash (3:00) Potion

name: Leaping Splash (2:15) Potion

This splash potion will apply up to 6 minutes of the water breathing potion effect to nearby entities. The water breathing potion effect allows you to 'breath underwater'. This means you won't take any damage from lack of breath when underwater and the potion effect is active.

name: Invisibility Splash (6:00) Potion
description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply up to 6 minutes of the invisibility potion effect to nearby entities. The invisibility potion effect, as the name would suggest, makes you invisible.

name: Splash Turtle Master Potion (0:20)

name: Splash Turtle Master Potion (0:40)
description: This splash potion will give players within proximity of its splash Slowness IV and Resistance III.

name: Splash Turtle Master Potion II (0:20)
description: This splash potion will give players within proximity of its splash Slowness VI and Resistance IV.

name: Splash Slow Falling Potion (1:30)
description: This splash potion will give players within proximity of its splash the Slow Falling potion effect for 1 minute 30 seconds, which, as you might have already guessed, makes those under its effects fall slowly (as-if gravity has a lesser effect). They will also not take fall damage and be unable to break crops by jumping on them.

name: Splash Slow Falling Potion (4:00)
description: This splash potion will give players within proximity of its splash the Slow Falling potion effect for 4 minutes, which, as you might have already guessed, makes those under its effects fall slowly (as-if gravity has a lesser effect). They will also not take fall damage and be unable to break crops by jumping on them.

name: Bottle o' Enchanting
description: The enchantment bottle, otherwise known as an exp bottle, is used to give a player experience to enchant in Minecraft. To use an enchantment bottle, right click it and it will be thrown on the floor and splash exp orbs around the impact location.

name: Fire Charge
description: Fire charges can be made using 1 blaze powder, 1 gun powder and 1 charcoal. They are launched as a projectile fireball when dispensed from a dispenser in Minecraft.

name: Book and Quill
description: The book and quill in Minecraft can be used to write a book. To write inside, right click the book and a book interface will open. You must sign the book to save the contents.

name: Written Book
description: The written book is obtained when book and quill is signed. The written book can be right clicked to open a book interface with the content of the signed book inside.

name: Emerald
description: The emerald item can be obtained from both villagers and emerald ore which is only found in the extreme hills biome. It is mainly used to trade with villagers, as you can exchange emeralds with them for many useful items in Minecraft.

name: Item Frame
description: Item frames in Minecraft can be used to.. frame items. They can be made using 1 leather item and 8 sticks. To put an item in an item frame, right click the item frame with the item you want to frame in your hand.

name: Flower Pot
description: To make a flower pot, 3 bricks in Minecraft are required. You can place plants such as cacti and flowers in plant pots. To do this, right click a plant pot with the plant you want to put inside.

name: Carrot
description: Carrots in Minecraft are foods item that can also be farmed. To plant a carrot, right click hoed dirt with the carrot item. To consume a carrot, hold right click with a carrot in your hand.

properties.recipes_used_in: Golden Carrot, Carrot on a Stick, Rabbit Stew

name: Potato
description: Potatoes in Minecraft are a food item that can also be farmed. To plant a potato, right click hoed dirt with the carrot item. To consume a potato, hold right click with a carrot in your hand.

name: Baked Potato
description: A baked potato can be made by putting a potato, with fuel, in a furnace. It restores more hunger than a regular potato, and cannot be planted.

name: Poisonous Potato
description: Poisonous potatoes have a 1 in 50 chance of being dropped when a potato is farmed. They have a 60% chance of giving the poison potion effect when eaten, and cannot be replanted.

name: Empty Map
description: Maps (empty) in Minecraft can be used to get a birds eye view of the world and find your way about. They can be made using 9 paper.

name: Golden Carrot
description: Golden carrots in Minecraft can be made using a carrot and 8 golden ingots. They can be consumed, fed to animals and also are a brewing ingredient.

name: Skeleton Skull
description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a skeleton.

name: Wither Skeleton Skull
description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a wither skeleton.

name: Player Head
description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a human or player. It can be assigned meta data to display the skin head of an actual username.

name: Zombie Head
description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a zombie.

name: Creeper Head
description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a creeper.

name: Dragon Head
description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of an enderdragon.

name: Carrot on a Stick
description: This item can be used to lure pigs in Minecraft. It can be made by placing a carrot and a fishing rod in the crafting table.. creative, huh?

name: Nether Star
description: Nether stars are required to make beacons and are dropped by the wither boss from the nether in Minecraft.

name: Pumpkin Pie
description: Pumpkin pies are a food item that can be made with a pumpkin, 1 sugar and 1 egg. To consume the pumpkin pie, hold right click whilst the item is in your hand.

name: Firework Rocket
description: Fireworks can be customized to make extravagant particle explosions in the game. This is the base item that is required to make them!

name: Firework Star
description: Firework stars are made with dyes and gunpowder! A firework charge is the item that is used to customize the size, effect and color of a firework.

name: Enchanted Book
description: Enchanted books in Minecraft are used to apply enchantments to items, without the need for an enchantment table. They cannot be crafted, but can be found in dungeons. An anvil is require to apply the enchantment specified by the book to an item.

name: Nether Brick
description: Netherbricks can be made by smelting netherrack, with a fuel, in a furnace in Minecraft. They are used to create decorative blocks like the nether brick block.

properties.recipes_used_in: Nether Bricks, Nether Brick Fence, Red Nether Bricks

name: Nether Quartz
description: Quartz can be obtained from quartz ore in the nether. It is used to create daylight sensors, along with other decorative blocks and redstone utilities.

properties.recipes_used_in: Granite, Diorite, Daylight Detector, Block of Quartz, Observer, Redstone Comparator

name: Minecart with TNT
description: Minecarts with TNT are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with TNT inside. They cannot take a passenger. They can obviously be.. DETONATED!

name: Minecart with Hopper
description: Minecarts with hoppers are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with hoppers. They cannot take a passenger. When right clicked, they open up the hopper interface.

name: Prismarine Shard
description: Prismarine shards are dropped by guardians and elder guardians. They can be used to create decorative prismarine blocks.

properties.recipes_used_in: Prismarine, Prismarine Bricks, Dark Prismarine, Sea Lantern

name: Prismarine Crystals
description: Prismarine Crystals are dropped by guardians and elder guardians. They can be used to create decorative prismarine blocks.

name: Raw Rabbit
description: Raw rabbit in Minecraft is dropped when a rabbit is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked rabbit, which is a food item.

name: Cooked Rabbit
description: Cooked rabbit in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw rabbit is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.

name: Rabbit Stew
description: Rabbit stew is a food item that can be consumed to restore hunger. It is made using a bowl, mushroom, carrot, potato and of course.. a cooked rabbit.

name: Rabbit's Foot
description: A rabbit foot has a 1 in 10 chance of being dropped when a rabbit is killed. It is used as a brewing ingredient and cannot be consumed.. who would want to eat a rabbit's foot?!

name: Rabbit Hide
description: Rabbit hide is dropped by a rabbit on death. 4 rabbit hides can be used to create leather.

name: Armor Stand

name: Iron Horse Armor
description: Horse armor acts exactly like regular armor for players, but can be equipped by horses and provides them with extra defence.

name: Golden Horse Armor

name: Diamond Horse Armor

name: Lead

name: Name Tag

name: Minecart with Command Block
description: Minecarts with command blocks are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with command blocks inside. They cannot take a passenger.

name: Raw Mutton
description: Raw mutton in Minecraft is dropped when a sheep is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked mutton, which is a food item.

name: Cooked Mutton

description: This is the block that represents the crystals that spawn on the top of columns in the end.

name: Chorus Fruit
description: Chorus fruit can be both consumed, and cooked. When eaten, it will restore 4 hunger. It can be obtained from chorus plants, which grow naturally only in the end.

name: Popped Chorus Fruit
description: Popper chorus fruit can be made by cooking chorus fruit. It is used as a crafting ingredient. It cannot be eaten.

name: Beetroot
description: Beetroot is a food item that can be consumed to satiate your hunger. It can also be used to breed and lure pigs.

name: Beetroot Seeds
description: Beetroot seeds are a farming item used to.. grow beetroot. To plant beetroot seeds, right click them on hoed dirt. Given the right lighting conditions and nearby water, they will grow into beetroot.

name: Beetroot Soup
description: Beetroot soup can be made using a bowl, a mushroom and a beetroot. It is a food item that can be consumed to satiate your hunger levels.

name: Dragon's Breath
description: The dragon's breath item can only be obtained by using an empty glass bottle around the ender dragon's breath attack. It can be used in the brewing of lingering potions.

name: Spectral Arrow
description: When a spectral arrow hits a target, it creates an outline around the entity. This is useful as it provides an x-ray (in a sense), so that you do not lose your target.

name: Tipped Arrow
description: Tipped arrows inflict a potion effect when they hit their target. There are many different arrows, each having an individual potion effect such as strength or poison.

name: Shield
description: A shield in Minecraft can be crafted using 6 wooden planks and 1 iron ingot. It can be equipped in your off-hand to provide extra defence.

name: Elytra
description: An elytra allows you to glide and fly in Minecraft. They are found only in end cities, and cannot be crafted. It is equipped in the chestplate armor slot.

name: Spruce Boat
description: Spruce boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 spruce planks, and put on water by right click.

name: Birch Boat
description: Birch boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 birch planks, and put on water by right click.

name: Jungle Boat
description: Jungle boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 jungle planks, and put on water by right click.

name: Acacia Boat
description: Acacia boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 acacia planks, and put on water by right click.

name: Dark Oak Boat
description: Dark oak boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 dark oak planks, and put on water by right click.

name: Totem of Undying
description: The totem of undying item is dropped by evokers in Minecraft. It will save a player from death if it is equipped when they die.

name: Shulker Shell
description: The shulker shell is used to create shulker boxes (along with a chest) in Minecraft. It is dropped by.. shulkers!

name: Iron Nugget
description: Iron nuggets can be made by placing an iron ingot in the crafting table in Minecraft. They have little to no use currently.

properties.recipes_used_in: Iron Ingot, Lantern, Chain, Soul Lantern

name: Knowledge Book
description: This item can only be spawned in using its spawn commands that are found on this page. This book can be used to unlock crafting recipes (if they are locked, for example by the doLimitedCrafting gamerule).

name: Debug Stick
description: This item can be spawned in using its spawn commands that are found on this page. It can be used to edit block states - simply hit a block with it to cycle through blockstates, shifting and hitting a block will cycle through blockstates in reverse order.

name: 13 Disc
description: This music dic plays record '13'. Music discs can be found in dungeons in Vanilla Minecraft. When right clicked on a jukebox, the track of the music disc, or record, plays.

name: Trident
description: The trident is dropped by drowneds and can be picked up if thrown. It can be used as both a melee weapon and ranged (by throwing it). It can be thrown by holding right click until fully charged.

name: Phantom Membrane
description: The phantom membrane is sometimes dropped by phantoms when they are killed. It can be used to repair the elytra and as a brewing ingredient in the slow falling potion

name: Nautilus Shell
description: The only use of this item currently is in the crafting recipe of conduits. They can be obtained via fishing and rarely, by drowneds.

name: Heart of the Sea
description: This item cannot be crafted, it can only be found within buried treasure chests. It can be used to craft a conduit by placing it in the center of a crafting bench surrounded by 8 nautilus shells.

name: Water
description: The still water block is the block that is created when you right click a water bucket. This item is not available in Vanilla Minecraft, or creative mode. It must be spawned in with the /give command.

name: Lava
description: The still lava block is the block that is created when you right click a lava bucket. This item is not available in Vanilla Minecraft, or creative mode. It must be spawned in with the /give command.

name: Tall Seagrass
description: Tall seagrass is a taller (2 block high) variant of regular sea grass. It grows underwater.

name: Piston Head
description: A piston head is no obtainable in Vanilla Minecraft. It is the block that is pushed outwards from a regular piston when it is activated.

name: Moving Piston
description: The piston extension block is not obtainable in vanilla Minecraft. It is a block added in Minecraft 1.13, but is invisible, cannot be broken easily (you have to use commands/TNT) and is not solid.

name: Wall Torch
description: This is the block that takes the place of a torch when it is placed on a wall.

name: Fire
description: Fire is the block that takes the place of fire in Minecraft. Whilst this block cannot be spawned into your inventory in Minecraft, it is created when you right click with a flint and steel on the ground, or in other situations like when blaze shoots.

name: Redstone Dust
description: Redstone wire is the block that is created when redstone is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be crafted or obtained in Vanilla Minecraft as an item. Its primary function is to carry redstone current.

name: Wall Sign
description: The wall mounted sign block is the block that is created when you right click a sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a regular sign item.

name: Redstone Wall Torch
description: This is an unobtainable item (it cannot be inside your inventory). It takes the place of a redstone torch when you place it on a wall.

name: Nether Portal
description: The portal block is created when a nether portal is formed in Minecraft. When stood in for 3 seconds, a user is teleported to the nether. This block cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. It is commonly used on Minecraft server hubs as a portal.

name: Attached Pumpkin Stem
description: This is an unobtainable block (it cannot be placed in your inventory). It takes the place of a pumpkin stem when attached to a pumpkin.

name: Attached Melon Stem
description: This is an unobtainable block (it cannot be placed in your inventory). It takes the place of a melon stem when attached to a melon.

name: Pumpkin Stem
description: Pumpkin stem blocks are not obtainable as items in Vanilla Minecraft. They are the block that is generated in the world to show the growth progress of a pumpkin plant.

name: Melon Stem
description: Melon stem blocks are not obtainable as items in Vanilla Minecraft. They are the block that is generated in the world to show the growth progress of a melon plant.

name: End Portal
description: The end portal block cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft but is used by Minecraft to display the 'end portal effect'. It also is useful as a light source in Minecraft builds as it cannot be seen when looked at from below. The end portal block can be spawned in using WorldEdit (as it cannot be obtained as an inventory item). The item image shown below is the incorrect image. This item is the end portal block, not the nether portal block.

name: Cocoa
description: The cocoa block cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft - it is the block that grows on trees when cocoa beans are planted. When broken, cocoa beans are dropped (the amount is based on how much the cocoa bean block has grown). It is a useful ingredient in several crafting recipes, such as dyes.

name: Tripwire
description: Tripwire in Minecraft can be used in redstone circuits to detect entities.

name: Potted Oak Sapling

name: Potted Cactus

name: Carrots
description: This is the carrot crop block that spawns when the carrot item is right clicked on hoed land. It cannot be obtained as an item. When broken (it breaks instantly with any item), it drops the carrot item.

name: Potatoes
description: This is the potatoes crop block that spawns when the potato item is right clicked on hoed land. It cannot be obtained as an item. When broken (it breaks instantly with any item), it drops the potato item.

name: Skeleton Wall Skull
description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the skeleton mob head item when it is placed in the world.

name: Wither Skeleton Wall Skull
description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the wither mob head item when it is placed in the world.

name: Zombie Wall Head
description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the zombie head item when it is placed in the world.

name: Player Wall Head
description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the player head item when it is placed in the world.

name: Creeper Wall Head
description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the creeper head item when it is placed in the world.

name: Dragon Wall Head
description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the dragon head item when it is placed in the world.

name: Beetroots
description: Beetroot in Minecraft is a grown vegetable similar to carrots and potatos, this block is what appears in the world when it is placed and growing.

name: End Gateway
description: The end gateway is the portal block that is used to teleport players from the end world to the overworld, and vice versa. It can also be used as a decorative block because of its beam.

name: Frosted Ice
description: The frosted ice block has all the same properties as a regular Minecraft ice block. It melts faster than regular ice dependent on light - meaning in dark places it will not melt.

name: Kelp Plant
description: This is the block that takes the place of kelp when it grows. Kelp can grow as high as there is water above it.

name: Void Air
description: This is the block that takes the place of empty air in the void.

name: Cave Air
description: This is the block that takes the place of empty air inside caves

name: Bubble Column
description: Bubble columns spawn naturally, and can be generated by placing either soul sand or magma blocks underwater. They can be used to move entities such as items in the direction they are pushing/pulling in.

name: Creeper Spawner
description: This is the item ID for a creeper spawner which is a mob spawner. Mob spawners, or monster spawners, are blocks that spawn mobs when placed. Conditions (e.g. light levels) relative to the mob type of the spawner must still be met in order for the monster to spawn. They are often used in grinders, and can be found in dungeons but cannot be mined in Vanilla Minecraft.

name: Bee Spawn Egg
description: As the name suggests, the Bee Spawn Egg will spawn a bee when you hold the item in your hand and right click a block. Bees are naturally non-aggressive mobs that won't attack unless provoked. When provoked (i.e. if you hit them), they will attempt to sting, and if successful, poison you. Bees are also crucial to bee hives.

name: Honeycomb
description: The Honeycomb item was brought along in Minecraft 1.15 and can be harvested from both bee hives and bee nests. To obtain this item (without spawn commands) you will have to shear a hive or nest which can result in the inhabitants (bees!) attacking.

name: Bee Nest
description: Bees nests naturally spawn on trees and house a colony of bees. They can be used to obtain honeycombs. Trees in Plains and Sunflower Plains biomes are much more likely to house a bees nest, but as these have low amounts of trees, your best chance of *encountering* a bee nest is within the Flower Forest biome (within which, 1 in every 50 trees will be home to a bees nest).

name: Beehive
description: Bee hives are similar to bees nests in that they house bees, but they do not spawn naturally and must be crafted. Bees who are pollinated will naturally fly into bee hives and start to produce honeycombs. Once ready, these honeycombs can be harvested by using sheers on the block. The crafting recipe for bee hives can be found on this page and requires both planks and honeycombs.

name: Honey Bottle
description: Honey bottles are craftable items that will restore 6 hunger (3 total hunger points) and will also clear any poison potion effects when consumed.

name: Honey Block
description: Honey blocks require 4 honey bottles to craft. They are transparent, sticky blocks that will slow any mobs and players down when in contact with them.

name: Honeycomb Block
description: Honeycomb blocks are blocks made from 4 honeycombs. Having no function, these blocks are currently only decorational. You cannot convert these blocks back into their original crafting ingredients (in the same way that you would with a diamond block).

name: Oak Wall Sign
description: The oak wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click an oak sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops an oak sign item.

name: Spruce Wall Sign
description: The spruce wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a spruce sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a spruce sign item.

name: Birch Wall Sign
description: The birch wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a birch sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a birch sign item.

name: Acacia Wall Sign
description: The acacia wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click an acacia sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops an acacia sign item.

name: Jungle Wall Sign
description: The jungle wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a jungle sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a jungle sign item.

name: Dark Oak Wall Sign
description: The dark oak wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a dark oak sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a dark oak sign item.

name: Potted Cornflower
description: This is the block that represents a potted cornflower when you place a cornflower in a flower pot.

name: Potted Lily of the Valley
description: This is the block that represents a potted lily of the valley when you place a lily of the valley in a flower pot.

name: Potted Wither Rose
description: This is the block that represents a potted wither rose when you place a wither rose in a flower pot.

name: Bamboo Sapling
description: Bamboo saplings can be obatained by breaking bamboo trees. Bamboo trees naturally spawn within jungles and give you bamboo when broken. When you right click a bamboo sapling on the ground, it will be placed. After placing a bamboo sapling, provided conditions are satisfactory, it will grow into a bamboo plant.

name: Potted Bamboo
description: This is the block that represents a potted bamboo when you place a bamboo in a flower pot.

name: Sweet Berry Bush
description: This is the block that represents a sweet berry bush after it has either naturally generated or grown from a sweet berry seed.

name: Crimson Nylium
description: Crimson nylium generates naturally in the Crimson Forest Nether biome (introduced in Minecraft 1.16).

name: Warped Nylium
description: Warped nylium generates naturally in the Warped Forest Nether biome (introduced in Minecraft 1.16).

name: Crimson Planks
description: Crimson planks are made by placing either a crimson stem or a stripped crimson stem into the crafting grid. They are very similar to other variants of planks however, as they originate from the Nether, they are not useable as fuel (as they don't burn!).

name: Warped Planks
description: Warped planks are made by placing either a warped stem or a stripped warped stem into the crafting grid. They are very similar to other variants of planks however, as they originate from the Nether, they are not useable as fuel (as they don't burn!).

name: Nether Gold Ore
description: Nether gold ore is similar to normal gold ore but only spawns in the Nether. When mined, it will yield 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 gold ore items. Piglins, a mob native to the Nether, will attack if they notice you mining this block.

name: Crimson Stem
description: Crimson stems are the 'wood' of the trees (Huge crimson fungus) that grow in the Nether. As is the case with wood, axes are the fastest way to break this block.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smoker, Campfire, Crimson Planks, Crimson Hyphae, Soul Campfire

name: Warped Stem
description: Warped stems are the 'wood' of the trees (Huge warped fungus) that grow in the Nether. As is the case with wood, axes are the fastest way to break this block.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smoker, Campfire, Warped Planks, Warped Hyphae, Soul Campfire

name: Stripped Crimson Stem
description: This is the stripped variant of a crimson stem. It can be obtained by right clicking a crimson stem (when on the ground/in a huge fungus) and then cutting it with an axe.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smoker, Campfire, Crimson Planks, Stripped Crimson Hyphae, Soul Campfire

name: Stripped Warped Stem
description: This is the stripped variant of a warped stem. It can be obtained by right clicking a warped stem (when on the ground/in a huge fungus) and then cutting it with an axe.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smoker, Campfire, Warped Planks, Stripped Warped Hyphae, Soul Campfire

name: Stripped Crimson Hyphae
description: Stripped crimson hyphae is made from stripped crimsons stems.

name: Stripped Warped Hyphae
description: Stripped warped hyphae is made from stripped warped stems.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smoker, Campfire, Warped Planks, Soul Campfire

name: Crimson Hyphae
description: Crimson hyphae is made from crimson stems.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smoker, Campfire, Crimson Planks, Soul Campfire

name: Warped Hyphae
description: Warped hyphae is made from warped stems.

properties.recipes_used_in: Smoker, Campfire, Warped Planks, Soul Campfire

name: Crimson Fungus
description: Crimson fungus is effectively the Nether's version of a mushroom (along with warped fungus). It can be found within the crimson and warped forest biomes, but you are more likely to find this variant in the crimson forest.

name: Warped Fungus
description: Warped fungus is effectively the Nether's version of a mushroom (along with crimson fungus). It can be found within the crimson and warped forest biomes, but you are more likely to find this variant in the warped forest.

name: Crimson Roots
description: Crimson roots are native to the Nether and spawn within the crimson forest biome (and in rare cases, the warped forest or soul sand valley biomes). It is mainly a decorative block but can be placed in a composter.

name: Warped Roots
description: Warped roots are native to the Nether and spawn within the warped forest biome (and in rare cases, the crimson forest or soul sand valley biomes). It is mainly a decorative block but can be placed in a composter.

name: Nether Sprouts
description: Nether sprouts, as the name suggests, are items that spawn in the Nether within the warped forest biome. They can be used on a composter.

name: Weeping Vines
description: Weeping vines are similar to normal vines in that they can be climbed, but are native to the Nether and only spawn in the crimson forest biome (on huge crimson fungi, and also on the ceilings).

name: Twisting Vines
description: Twisting vines are similar to normal vines in that they can be climbed, but are native to the Nether and only spawn in the warped forest biome (on huge warped fungi, and also on the ceilings).

name: Crimson Slab
description: A crimson slab block can be crafted by placing 3 crimson planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

name: Warped Slab
description: A warped slab block can be crafted by placing 3 warped planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

name: Crimson Pressure Plate
description: This is the crimson plank variant of a pressure plate. It has similar properties to a normal pressure plate.

name: Warped Pressure Plate
description: This is the warped plank variant of a pressure plate. It has similar properties to a normal pressure plate.

name: Polished Blackstone Pressure Plate
description: This is the polished blackstone variant of a pressure plate. It has similar properties to a normal pressure plate.

name: Crimson Fence
description: Crimson fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence, made with crimson planks instead of normal planks. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table

name: Warped Fence
description: Warped fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence, made with warped planks instead of normal planks. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table

name: Soul Soil
description: Soul soil is a block native to the Nether, specifically the soul sand valley biome. It has many unique uses, including turning flames/fire ignited on it into soul fire, interchangeable with soul sand when spawning a wither, and the production of basalt.

name: Basalt
description: Basalt is a decorative block that spawns within the Nether. You can find it in the soul sand valley biome as a constituent of basalt pillars. It can also be generated using soul soil and lava.

name: Polished Basalt
description: Polished basalt is a decorative block that can be made by placing four basalt in a square formation within a crafting grid.

name: Soul Torch
description: Soul torches are similar to normal torches but are crafted using soul sand or soul soil in the bottom slot instead of a stick. They produce a smaller amount of light when compared to a normal torch, but will scare Piglins within 7 blocks of a torch away.

name: Crimson Trapdoor
description: The crimson trapdoor is a variant of a normal trapdoor but is instead crafted using 6 crimson planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

name: Warped Trapdoor
description: The warped trapdoor is a variant of a normal trapdoor but is instead crafted using 6 warped planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

name: Chain
description: Chains are crafted using 2 iron nuggets and 1 iron ingot. Although mainly decorative, they have some unique functions as they are not broken by pistons when pushed, and can also be attached to bells and laturns.

name: Crimson Fence Gate
description: Crimson fence gates in Minecraft are the crimson wood variant of normal fence gates. They are the same as wooden fence gates but they are crafted using crimson planks. They can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

name: Warped Fence Gate
description: Warped fence gates in Minecraft are the crimson wood variant of normal fence gates. They are the same as wooden fence gates but they are crafted using warped planks. They can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

name: Cracked Nether Bricks
description: Cracked nether bricks are decorative items that can be crafted by placing regular nether bricks within a furnace.

name: Chiseled Nether Bricks
description: Chiseled nether bricks are decorative items that can be crafted by placing two netherbrick slabs on top of eachother in a crafting grid.

name: Crimson Stairs
description: Crimson stairs are a variant of wooden stairs and can be made by placing 6 crimson planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Warped Stairs
description: Warped stairs are a variant of wooden stairs and can be made by placing 6 warped planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Blackstone Wall
description: Blackstone walls are similar to stone walls, but made with the native Nether block, blackstone. Walls can be used like fences as low-height blocks that prevent players and mobs jumping over.

name: Polished Blackstone Wall
description: Polished blackstone walls are similar to blackstone walls but are instead crafted with polished blackstone. Walls can be used like fences as low-height blocks that prevent players and mobs jumping over.

name: Polished Blackstone Brick Wall
description: Polished blackstone brick walls are similar to blackstone walls but are instead crafted with polished blackstone bricks. Walls can be used like fences as low-height blocks that prevent players and mobs jumping over.

name: Crimson Button
description: Crimson buttons are a variant of wooden buttons that are made using a crimson plank (instead of a regular plank). Like wooden buttons, they can be used to activate blocks and redstone circuits.

name: Warped Button
description: Warped buttons are a variant of wooden buttons that are made using a warped plank (instead of a regular plank). Like wooden buttons, they can be used to activate blocks and redstone circuits.

name: Polished Blackstone Button
description: Polished blackstone buttons are a variant of stone buttons that are made using a polished blackstone block (instead of regular stone). Like stone buttons, they can be used to activate blocks and redstone circuits.

name: Quartz Bricks
description: Quartz bricks are decorative blocks made with 4 quartz blocks.

name: Warped Wart Block
description: Warped wart blocks spawn naturally within the warped forest biome. They are similar to the nether wart block, which is also native to the Nether. Unlike, the nether wart block, they don't prevent mobs from spawning on top of them.

name: Crimson Door
description: Crimsons doors in Minecraft are a variant of wooden doors made with crimson planks. Standing at two blocks in height, they can be opened and closed by right clicking the block. To place a door, right click the door item on the ground. If the supporting block underneath a door is broken, the door will also break.

name: Warped Door
description: Warped doors in Minecraft are a variant of wooden doors made with warped planks. Standing at two blocks in height, they can be opened and closed by right clicking the block. To place a door, right click the door item on the ground. If the supporting block underneath a door is broken, the door will also break.

name: Netherite Ingot
description: Netherite ingots are crafted using netherite scraps and golden ingots. They are used as a crafting ingredient in both the lodestone and the block of netherite. When paired with a diamond item in a smithing table, an equivalent netherite tool will be yielded.

name: Netherite Scrap
description: Netherite scraps can be obtained by smelting ancient debris. They are used to created netherite ingots. Naturally, they may spawn within treasure chests, generic chests, and hoglin stable chests within Bastion remnants.

name: Netherite Sword
description: The netherite sword is the best melee weapon in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond sword.

name: Netherite Shovel
description: The netherite shovel is the best shovel in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond shovel.

name: Netherite Pickaxe
description: The netherite pickaxe is the best pickaxe in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond pickaxe.

name: Netherite Axe
description: The netherite axe is the best axe in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond axe.

name: Netherite Hoe
description: The netherite hoe is the best hoe in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond hoe.

name: Netherite Helmet
description: Requiring a diamond helmet and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, the netherite helmet is currently the best helmet in the game.

name: Netherite Chestplate
description: Requiring a diamond chestplate and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, the netherite chestplate is currently the best body armor in the game.

name: Netherite Leggings
description: Requiring diamond leggings and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, netherite leggings are currently the best leg armor in the game.

name: Netherite Boots
description: Requiring diamond boots and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, netherite boots are currently the best defence item for the foot slot in the game.

name: Crimson Sign
description: The crimson sign is a variant of a regular sign made with crimson planks. It can be placed on the floor, or on a block, and have a message written on.

name: Warped Sign
description: The warped sign is a variant of a regular sign made with warped planks. It can be placed on the floor, or on a block, and have a message written on.

name: Hoglin Spawn Egg
description: Hoglin spawn eggs can be right clicked on the ground to spawn a Hoglin. Hoglins are mobs native to the Nether that are aggressive. When killed, they will drop leather and raw porkchop.

name: Piglin Spawn Egg
description: The Piglin spawn egg is an item that, when right clicked on a block, will spawn a piglin mob. Piglins are aggressive mobs that usually only spawn within the Nether. They are aggressive towards any players that aren't wearing an item of golden armor.

name: Strider Spawn Egg
description: Strider spawn eggs are items used to spawn Striders. They can be activated by right clicking on a block with the spawn egg in your character's hand. Striders are mobs that usually only spawn in the Nether. Water and rain will harm Striders. They are passive mobs.

name: Zoglin Spawn Egg
description: When right clicked on a block, this item will spawn a zoglin mob. A zoglin is created when a regular hoglin enters a world other than the Nether (and stays there for more than 15 seconds). They are extremely aggressive mobs.

name: Zombified Piglin Spawn Egg
description: This item will spawn a zombified piglin mob when right clicked on a block. Zombified piglins are mobs that will only attack if provoked.

name: Warped Fungus on a Stick
description: This item functions similarly to a carrot on a stick, but instead of directing pigs, it can be used to direct Striders when they are being ridden. It is crafted with a regular fishing rod and warped fungus.

name: Music Disc
description: Music discs can be placed into jukeboxes to play a music track. This disc in particular will play the Pigstep track. This item is only found within the Nether, inside bastion remnants.

name: Soul Lantern
description: Soul lanterns emit the same amount of light as soul torches, 10. They can be hung or placed on many blocks, including chains.

name: Soul Campfire
description: The soul campfire is a variant of the campfire that is made using soul sand or soul soil instead of coal. Its flames are blue in color.

name: Shroomlight
description: The shroomlight is a powerful light source, emitting a light level of 15. It sometimes spawns naturally on top of huge fungi (both crimson and warped variants).

name: Lodestone
description: Lodestones are made using 8 chiseled stone bricks and 1 netherite ingot. When a compass is right clicked on a lodestone, it will then point towards that lodestone.

name: Block of Netherite
description: A block of netherite can be crafted by placing 9 netherite ingots in a crafting grid. It can be changed back into its original ingredients, making it useful for efficient storage.

name: Ancient Debris
description: Ancient debris is the rarest ore in the game, only spawning in the Nether and at a rare rate. It can be smelted to yield 2 netherite scrap.

name: Target
description: Targets are blocks that will emit a redstone charge when a projectile hits them. The redstone charge will be emitted for for 0.4 seconds (4 redstone ticks).

name: Crying Obsidian
description: Crying obsidian originates in the Nether within ruined portals and chests found inside basion remnants. It is a crucial ingredient in the crafting recipe for a respawn anchor.

name: Blackstone
description: Blackstone is often dubbed 'the Nether's cobblestone' as it is native to the Nether and shares many similar properties. They can be found within basalt deltas and bastion remnants. They can replace cobblestone in crafting recipes.

properties.recipes_used_in: Furnace, Stone Sword, Stone Shovel, Stone Pickaxe, Stone Axe, Stone Hoe, Blackstone Wall, Blackstone Slab, Blackstone Stairs, Polished Blackstone

name: Blackstone Slab
description: Blackstone slabs are a variant of stone slabs, being crafted by placing 3 blackstone in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Blackstone Stairs
description: Blackstone stairs are a variant of stone stairs and can be made by placing 6 blackstone in a crafting grid in the correct formation. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Gilded Blackstone
description: Gilded blackstone, being native to the Nether, spawns within bastion remnants. When mined, it may drop itself or 2, 3, 4, or 5 golden nuggets.

name: Polished Blackstone
description: Polished blackstone is a decorative block that can be crafted by placing 4 blackstone in a crafting grid.

properties.recipes_used_in: Polished Blackstone Pressure Plate, Polished Blackstone Wall, Polished Blackstone Button, Polished Blackstone Slab, Polished Blackstone Stairs, Polished Blackstone Bricks

name: Polished Blackstone Slab
description: Polished blackstone slabs are a variant of blackstone slabs, being crafted by placing 3 polished blackstone in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Polished Blackstone Stairs
description: Polished blackstone stairs are a variant of blackstone stairs and can be made by placing 6 polished blackstone in a crafting grid in the correct formation. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Chiseled Polished Blackstone
description: Chiseled polished blackstone is a decorative block that can be crafted by placing two polished blackstone slabs on top of eachother in a crafting grid.

name: Polished Blackstone Bricks
description: Polished blackstone bricks are a decorative block that can be crafted by placing 4 polished blackstone in a crafting grid.

properties.recipes_used_in: Polished Blackstone Brick Wall, Polished Blackstone Brick Slab, Polished Blackstone Brick Stairs

name: Polished Blackstone Brick Slab
description: Polished blackstone brick slabs are a variant of polished blackstone slabs, being crafted by placing 3 polished blackstone bricks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

name: Polished Blackstone Brick Stairs
description: Polished blackstone brick stairs are a variant of polished blackstone stairs and can be made by placing 6 polished blackstone bricks in a crafting grid in the correct formation. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

name: Cracked Polished Blackstone Bricks
description: Cracked polished blackstone bricks are a decorative variant of polished blackstone bricks. They are created by smelting blackstone bricks in a furance (or equivalent).

name: Respawn Anchor
description: The respawn anchor is an item that allows you to respawn at its location in the Nether. As beds don't work in the Nether, this item is crucial for those setting up a base in the Nether world. It can be crafted using 6 crying obsidian and 3 glowstone.

name: Soul Fire
description: Soul fire is a block that cannot be obtained in item form. It is created when a fire is started on top of soul sand or soul soil.

name: Soul Wall Torch
description: The soul wall torch is a block variant (cannot be obtained in item form) of the soul torch that is created when you place a soul torch on a wall.

name: Weeping Vines Plant
description: This is the block form of the weeping vines item that is created when weeping vines are dangled (not in contact with a wall). It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory.

name: Twisting Vines Plant
description: This is the block form of the twisting vines item that is created when twisting vines are dangled (not in contact with a wall). It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory.

name: Crimson Wall Sign
description: The crimson wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a crimson sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a crimson sign item.

name: Warped Wall Sign
description: The warped wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a warped sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a warped sign item.

name: Potted Crimson Fungus
description: This is the block that represents a potted crimson fungus when you place a crimson fungus in a flower pot.

name: Potted Warped Fungus
description: This is the block that represents a potted warped fungus when you place a warped fungus in a flower pot.

name: Potted Crimson Roots
description: This is the block that represents a potted crimson root when you place a crimson root in a flower pot.

name: Potted Warped Roots
description: This is the block that represents a potted warped root when you place a warped root in a flower pot.
